intro: Craspedoneuron album, commonly known as the white craspedoneuron, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland areas or along stream banks. Its flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies, due to their nectar-rich structure. The plant is also noted for its aromatic foliage, which contains compounds responsible for its distinctive scent.
